intro: Seddera welwitschii subsp. tenuisepala, commonly known as the narrow-lobed seddera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
